Comment: >“Over the past months, it has also become clear that I would not be allowed to run the show as I have always run it,” Owens told staffers in a memo Tuesday, adding: “So, having defended this show — and what we stand for — from every angle, over time with everything I could,  I am stepping aside so the show can move forward.”   If I read correctly, the corporate board members know their business will be harassed by Russian Asset if ***Sixty Minutes*** continues its investigative reporting. How is this not *a prior* restraint of trade?
Author: Still_Mix3277

Comment: Paramount bent the knee too, huh. Depressing.
Author: jgilla2012

Comment: This kinda highlights the problem with being a news organization that's also a corporation. You literally have a fiduciary duty to maximize profit for your shareholders, and that's put above journalistic integrity.    We really need more strong and principled independent media.
Author: ColeBeasleyMD
